xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates
Class ConfidenceAggregationFunction

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<Number,Number>
      xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates.ConfidenceAggregationFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public abstract class ConfidenceAggregationFunction
extends AggregationFunction<Number,Number>

In the context of online aggregation aggregates are iteratively computed. The data is successively consumed and the current estimator respectively aggregate bases on the already processed elements. In order to provide a quality statement for the current estimate, confidence intervals can be computed. Let Y_n be for instance the current estimate, alpha the confidence level and epsilon the current confidence. Then the final result (i.e. the estimate based on all data) is in [Y_n-epsilon,Y_n+epsilon] with probability p=1-alpha.
This class provides a framework for aggregation functions providing a confidence interval for the current aggregate. Furthermore, this class contains a collection of factories for concrete aggregation functions.
A more detailed coverage of the theory and the resulting formulas is given in
[Haa97]: Peter J. Haas: Large-Sample and Deterministic Confidence Intervals for Online Aggregation, Ninth International Conference on Scientific and Statistical Database Management, Proceedings, 1997.

See Also:
Aggregator, Function, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ConfidenceAggregationFunction

public ConfidenceAggregationFunction()
Method Detail

largeSampleConfidenceVarianceEstimator

public static ConfidenceAggregationFunction largeSampleConfidenceVarianceEstimator(double alpha)
Provides a factory that computes confidence intervals for the current estimate of the variance estimator. The bounds of the confidence interval base on the central limit theorem (CLT). See [Haa97] for further details.

Parameters:
alpha - confidence level
Returns:
a function that computes epsilon for the current estimate
See Also:
VarianceEstimator, FourthCentralMomentEstimator

conservativeConfidenceAverage

public static ConfidenceAggregationFunction conservativeConfidenceAverage(double alpha,
                                                                          double a,
                                                                          double b)
Provides a factory that computes confidence intervals for the current estimate of the standard deviation estimator. The bounds of the confidence interval are deterministic and base on Hoeffding's Inequality. See [Haa97] for further details.

Parameters:
alpha - confidence level
a - minimum of the data domain
b - maximum of the data domain
Returns:
a function that computes epsilon for the current estimate
See Also:
VarianceEstimator, FourthCentralMomentEstimator

deterministicConfidenceAverage

                                                                           double b,
                                                                           long N)
Provides a factory that computes confidence intervals for the current estimate of the standard deviation estimator. The bounds of the confidence interval are deterministic. See [Haa97] for further details.

Parameters:
a - minimum of the data domain
b - maximum of the data domain
N - number of elements of the entirety
Returns:
a function that computes epsilon for the current estimate

lambda

protected static double lambda(long N,
                               long n,
                               double a,
                               double b,
                               double avg)
Computes lambda_n = ( 1- n/N) * ( (b-a)^4/4 + (n/N) * max( avg_n-a, b-avg_n)^2).

Parameters:
N - long value
n - long value
a - double value
b - double value
avg - double value
Returns:
lambda_n

Bn

                           double a,
                           double b,
                           double p)
Computes a temporal variable.

Parameters:
n - long value
a - double value
b - double value
p - double value
Returns:
Bn

epsilon

public Object epsilon()
               throws IllegalStateException,
                      UnsupportedOperationException
If an inheriting class doesn't overwrite this method and thus provides the computation of confidence intervals, this operation is not supported.

Returns:
current epsilon
Throws:
IllegalStateException - no valid state
UnsupportedOperationException - if computation of confidence intervals not supported

confidence

public double confidence()
                  throws UnsupportedOperationException
If an inheriting class doesn't overwrite this method and thus provides the computation of confidence intervals, this operation is not supported.

Returns:
p=1-alpha
Throws:
IllegalStateException - no valid state
UnsupportedOperationException - if computation of confidence intervals is not supported

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
